website_summaries.verdict: A multi-functional power delivery system with occasional performance issues.
pros: Successfully starts most cars and trucks
Includes a compressor for tire inflation
cons: Occasional complaints about air compressor effectiveness

customer_reviews.title: Will not honor warranty.
customer_reviews.text: Total POS. 120 v plug did not work. Schumacher would only honor it if I ship it to them. The unit weights 30lbs. It cost almost $80 to ship it. The one year warranty is BS because you have to ship it to them. I will never buy another Schumacher product again because their customer service is horrible and the warranty procedure is design for you to not return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bum L.

customer_reviews.title: Dead after less than a year. Warranty requires buyer to pay for repair shipping.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June of last year. I used it three times, and really liked it. Once was to pump up a bicycle tire. The other was to jump start my car. The other was to run by CPAP while camping. It performed well. For several months, I didn't have use for it. It was always on the charger, per the instructions. Now it's dead. I called about warranty service, but that required ME to pay to ship the (very heavy) item back. I'm not spending upwards of $50 more to ship the item when it's likely to die again.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great product for folks on the go.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter who travels with a F-350 hauling a pumper pull trailer with her horse aboard. They ride in remote places, this is perfect for not only charging devices, but having a light at night so the truck battery is not used. Last week the I went to start the truck and the battery was dead. I clipped the jumper cables on, turned the switch and it started the truck the 1st time! Really impressed me, so now I don't worry as much when my daughter takes off with her horse, they have lots of external power and an air compressor if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my $139
customer_reviews.text: Got this product on July 20, 2016 and it is not holding charging any more. Waste of my $139.99. Comes with only 12 months warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Jose G. Solorzano

customer_reviews.title: Warranty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in December of 2017 and the charging gauge no longer works. So now you cannot tell how much of a charge you have in the unit. I contacted Schumacher and was give the run around about the warranty and was finally told thy would fix it or send me a new unit. The problem is the unit weights around 25 pounds and I am suppose to pay for the shipping to Texas. What a deal, that's about 1/3 of what I paid for the unit. So in 8 months I'm suppose to pay another 1/3 of the cost of the unit that was never used.
customer_reviews.author: alois357

customer_reviews.title: Well I don't know if I received a dud or ...
customer_reviews.text: Well I don't know if I received a dud or what but this did not work for me at all. I was told by several people that use this exact model that they use theirs to plug in a couple lights AND a fan or space heater for outdoor shows. I plugged it in right away after receiving as the tag states to do but I could barely even power one 25w light. In fact, it wouldn't light, it flickered. The meter read 100% charged and the wattage being used read 13. Turned out to be junk, $100 worth of junk. I'm hoping to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Cat P

customer_reviews.title: Good cranking power and battery capacity combined with multiple types ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this now about a year and a half, and it has worked well when I have needed it. Good cranking power and battery capacity combined with multiple types of power outlet have made this a must have for around the house and out in the field. The compressor is loud and slow, but as it is intended for emergencies I would say it does its job just fine. The only time I have run in to battery life issues is when I used the 120v outlet to run a laptop all day. That pretty much did the battery in, and it required recharging. All in all a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Just plain doesn't work...which is particular frustrating in a product that is destined to be used for emergencies!
customer_reviews.text: This thing hasn't worked for me one darn time yet! About all it's good for is the little LED light on the front, and maybe the air compressor. It will neither jump start a battery, or properly function as a power inverter. Can't use the outlets, keep getting a R02 code. Battery says 100% but sure doesn't act like it is charged. Tried to call Schumacher directly, and their people just give you the runaround. Sure wish I could just get my money back and try something else!
customer_reviews.author: William C. Brunner

customer_reviews.title: You won't need it until you do
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it is heavier than a boatload of bowling balls but this bad boy is worth it! Multiple outlets let me charge anything and everything. I swear you can jump-start a Caterpillar with it. The tire inflator works like a champ for both my compact car's low profile tires and the bigger ones on my wife's Land Rover. It was worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: BEST EVER
customer_reviews.text: This might be the best item I have ever bought on amazon. So I bough two more. Sucker works and never seems to run out of power. I live on an island and the power goes out. I used one to keep my (Energy Star) deep freeze and a modem, While the other unit was running my Roku and my tv. We considered a gas generator but trusting the name Schumacher from past use we bought one. Every one who sees this goes crazy. My advice buy at least two, one for the house and one for the car. At these prices and this level of quality buy it before they wake up and charge more.
customer_reviews.author: Martin S.

customer_reviews.title: Works greay
customer_reviews.text: This tool works great. I followed the directions and charged for 32 hours. Then took it camping. Used it to power my CPAP machine without humidifier for three nights, charged my IPhone and blew up a single raft. I still had enough power for another night and jump start the car.
customer_reviews.author: Krons

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my CPAP at night
customer_reviews.text: As far as a battery backup for my CPAP, I was very pleased and got two full nights without recharging it in my trial run with it.Now, if and when I lose power at night, I can still get a good safe night sleep. Traveling will also be easier now with this portable power source. Very pleased with this item. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: built cheap would not recommend unless you plan on buying one every year
customer_reviews.text: well i used it for a while and the battery went bad and the compressor went completely not that it worked to great from the start this is the second one i bought and both charge plugs broke and as far as running my cpap machine it worked for about two hours and died almost suffocated me to death the price is great but plan on buying a couple of them in your life time i would recommend a more expensive one which will last a life time
customer_reviews.author: FLYINGWIZARD

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say as I'm in the midst of testing this product I just got, I love it! I wanted it for emergencies and camping and have been running a fan, lamp and two cell phones recharging for 4 hours now. It has performed fantastic. Does all of these very well and is just now approaching 50% power left.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hull

customer_reviews.title: Didn't jump my boat battery, let me down!
customer_reviews.text: had it for a year, used it a few times and now the cigarette lighter power supplies don't work and it will not jump start anything. USB works and 12v works as well as everything else. Boat battery died on the lake, tried to jump it with the box and no luck, Thank god an old couple in a fishing boat towed my 24fter to the docks as it was getting dark and a storm was coming in. What a big let down. and only 1 yr warranty for this $120 dollar (now inverter only) power box. Maybe fixable?
customer_reviews.author: John Fendick

customer_reviews.title: This charger has been a "life-saver"
customer_reviews.text: This charger has been a "life-saver" on several occasions. One of the best purchases I've made for emergency or back-up situations and for camping trips. Had a battery in our car die during our cold winter and this easily got the car started right up and it was super easy to connect without having to jockey another car along-side in the snow. - Used the pump to blow up an air mattress while camping, and to charge phones and other devices. I would definitely buy this again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Portable Battery!
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review 3 years after purchasing. This battery is still going strong! I've used it to jump cars, run computers, and power PA speakers at parties in the park for hours. Lets me know how many minutes it has remaining, easy to charge, and has been the perfect portable power source for me on a litany of occasions.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Low Cranking Power
customer_reviews.text: Starting current seems low for jump starts. I have jumped a V-6 minivan, V-10 Ram, and riding mower. Each was equally labored when starting, even with a full charge, but did start. Very slow compressor. Price point ($98) too high for performance. I would not purchase again for more than $45.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works great for many uses
customer_reviews.text: Works great for many uses. over the last two years, I have used it to jump start a car 4-5 times, Inflate tires several times and as a usb charger for our phones and tablet when camping. The 110V outlet has worked great to power an overhead led light to play cards when camping. It is much better than smaller camp lights or Coleman lamps. It worked for 5 days straight at the campsite and still had plenty of power left. It also held the charge really well and has held 99 % of its power when left unused for 6-7 months. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R

customer_reviews.title: Literally one of the best purchases I've ever made. I've even bought another 2 for my family members.
customer_reviews.text: I can't count how many times this thing has saved mine and several other peoples butt's. When my car battery went bad and I had to wait a few days for a new one to arrive I used this at least 10-15 times to start my car and the power level didn't go below 90%. The amount of features this thing has is insane. I've used the air compressor for tires, air mattresses, and inflatable toys. Charged my laptops, phones, and tablets with no issues. I've even bought another 2 for my family members who absolutely love them. I can't recommend this product enough,
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: It's come in handy since my snowblower's battery took a crap on me this season
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for occasional tent camping and to use as a jump starter. It's come in handy since my snowblower's battery took a crap on me this season. Pros: lightweight, compact, versatile, battery indicator, air compressor (slowly) pumps an automobile tire to 35PSI Cons: will not jump a dead 12V battery below 60% charge, makes an occasional beeping chime after few hours on battery
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: A travel by car nessecity
customer_reviews.text: A necessity for those who travel by car. Especially for anyone driving in cold weather. Dead batteries and flat tires can and do happen. But having the ability to get on your way faster by having this in your car or truck. A real lifesaver in cold weather this tool is a must. Has already come in handy and have only owned it for a month. When someone asks for a jump it's a safer way to help than hooking up your car with jumper cables and better for your vehicle. All I can say is that it is a nessecity not just a convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald wing

customer_reviews.title: After one year since I bought it there are two issue happened.
customer_reviews.text: After one year since I bought it there are two issue happened. I use this device only a couple of times but it seems to be broken already. First, while I am charging this device, it starts to make very noisy beeping sound every time. Second, two of the AC adapter which is on front side doesn't work anymore. I never buy any charger or jump starter from them any more.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good unit for the money. With USB ports, 12-volt DC and 120 volt AC outlets, this is much more than a jump starter. I use it to power my laptop, charge my phone, and last week used it to power a propane space heater outdoors--saved me the trouble of running a 100' lead cord. To ensure a longer life, use it often and occasionally run the battery down and recharge it. I've had this for a year now and it's still working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Monster

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it for the air compressor.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jumper pack to replace my Costco model from many years ago. Compared to that, this model is passable from a power standpoint. The built in inverter does its job. The air compressor is a total afterthought though. Awkwardly arranged on the back of the unit, it fills very slowly and shuts down after a few minutes and then you need to let it cool for about 10 more. It makes filling low tires a very frustrating experience. It's okay for topping up a few PSI though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kulka

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one of these, I followed all the directions for charging. Tried to blow up a bike tire and the unit overheated, liquid coming out of the battery. Amazon was great and sent me another one. However, it’s only been a few months and it’s not holding a charge now. Not a very quality product. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I use for trips to the lake, and it is worth the room to pack in. It is great for charging up devices, but also very handy to top off a tire or run a tool without having to string a long extension cord. Decent battery life, although it takes a while to recharge (I ended up getting 2 of these because of that so I could keep one in service while the other charges up)
customer_reviews.author: Sean M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not last long
customer_reviews.text: I bought this portable generator in 2013. Only used it about 6-7 times (worked great). However, when I really needed it during a storm (in 2016) it would not hold a charge. Best I can tell, the battery needs replacement; a pricey item. I would think that this item should last longer than 3 years without issues. Stinks.
customer_reviews.author: spiffma

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this thing. I have used every single part of it so far and multiple times and it works great. Make sure to charge it at least once a month up to 100% to keep the battery fresh but everything works and it works great. We take it when we go camping and you can plug in multiple devices and the battery last for a long time. You can also jump your car multiple times on the same battery no problem
customer_reviews.author: JerrynSteph

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a year now and do not travel or boat without it! It has been a lifesaver and we just purchased a second one for my father in law for his boat. We had a flat on the truck while pulling the camper and used it to fill the tire, we use it to charge cell phones while primitive camping among lots of other things, wouldn't leave town without it!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi W

customer_reviews.title: Throw it to the garbage or return it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a year ago, inflator does not work!!! Spent so much money than similar products. Useless on a Roadside emergency. Do not buy this!! Buy separate battery charger and inflator!!! Useless keeping in the trunk.I bought this item in 2015. Gave problems and did not work, I did dump to the garbage. I was stupid to buy the another Schumacher 2 years after. Gave problems and it's not working. So i thought write a review for customers NOT TO BUY THIS PRODUCT or BRAND AGAIN!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shehan W.

customer_reviews.title: Weak battery strength
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace my 10 year old Craftsman power pack. Doesn't have the lasting strength as my Craftsman. Suppose to have more output than my Craftsman. Would not buy this brand again!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Shadow

customer_reviews.title: Short working life
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well for the first 6 months or so. Since that point, the battery kept taking in a little less charge every time, but it stayed above 90. I am at 9 months now, and it suddenly dropped off a cliff to 4% max power holding. Regardless of how long I charge it, it never exceeds 4% charged capacity. I will update this review with the results of my call to the warranty folks.
customer_reviews.author: SherusV

customer_reviews.title: First one died after I...
customer_reviews.text: First one died after I used it to jump start my rider mower ~6 times. Called support, something went wrong on the board, nothing but an error code on the display. They took ~2 months to replace it, now I'm afraid to use it (saving for emergencies).
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Wears out fast
customer_reviews.text: First season this worked great. Now, only 2nd year of using this just during summer, and already I can only use half the battery before the output drops to nothing. So I bought one of the lithium batteries for less money that is tiny, is almost as powerful and won't lose effectiveness so quickly
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: GET this
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this brand. I did research after losing my last car portable charger, which was energizer, it only lasted a year. BUT this brand is still going strong, over a year now. It is easy to transport. It has everything you would need to charge, all in one device. I would buy again when my charger does die. This brand is the best of all, after trying few brands, but I always have come back to this brand! You can't go wrong at all with this charger.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is now a permanent item in my trunk. The compressor though slow to fill a car tire does last a long time. I have "saved the day" many times out on a job site when someone needs USB power or to plug in a charger for something. My only improvement would be a brighter light option.
customer_reviews.author: Bill from Souderton

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 both work Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Bought 2, both have performed very well. My son used his to jump his grand moms car he said at least 7 times on one charge. *note her alternator was going bad and not charging up the battery, so after each use it needed a jump. I used it on a F150 V8, had no problems. Note * do not use remote start when trying to jump. For what ever reason it doesn't work correctly, use the key, and all works fine. Take note on the precautions for charging it using a car 12v outlet, 30 minutes at a time max.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Hettel

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but keep an eye out for leaking acid
customer_reviews.text: This worked beautifully for two years, when suddenly it started leaking bettery acid and would not charge. There was no overuse or high voltage items plugged into it. Schumacher is a good brand, so I am ordering another, hoping that it was a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L Barke

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product when it is new. After a year, the buttons stopped working. One of the buttons was permanently pushed in, which kept draining the battery. I wasn't able to fix it.
customer_reviews.author: LMichele

customer_reviews.title: ... it with my CPAP last night and it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Tested it with my CPAP last night and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: barbw.

customer_reviews.title: Let's me camp with my kids (Scouts) and keep up with work.
customer_reviews.text: I took this to a week long campout with the scouts (along with a Sierra Wireless 313U) and my Macbook. While the days were filled with merit badges, swim tests, and cooking strange meals, this let me stay caught up with clients and work in the evenings. Used it to completely charge a 15" Macbook Pro and keep phones and camera batteries topped off all week. I don't think I came close to draining the charge. Back home I keep it as a backup for a sump pump or other emergency lighting. Great to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer - Midwest, US

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of these and it takes both to jump start my tundra in my driveway fresh off the charger. Neat features but as far as getting yourself out of a bind in the woods you can't carry 2 in your truck to make sure it works.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H.

customer_reviews.title: I have tested the inverter and the 12 volt plug ins and they seem to work fine. The work light works well
customer_reviews.text: The USB port doesn't work. I haven't jumped a vehicle with it. I have tested the inverter and the 12 volt plug ins and they seem to work fine. The work light works well. I Am however a little dissapointed that the usb plug in doesn't work. That would have been really handy.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W Walton

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to have!
customer_reviews.text: This rig saved my butt in the first days I owned it. Had it in my truck when I came out of work one afternoon to find I picked up a nail in a tire. A few days later it came in handy to jumpstart a car who’s battery had died as a result of extreme cold. I’m very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this product two years ago, too. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product two years ago, too. I would not go camping without it. It powers my devices, airs my tires, jumps my rig, and with a heating pad, warms my bed. My husband uses it around the home to use his electric tools in remote places. It is quiet and ready.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Good for boosting, inverter is a bummer.
customer_reviews.text: Good for 12 Boosting. Compressor is slow but ok.The Inverter however is picky, and only good for maybe 75w or 100w IF you stack the loads carefully. Better off plugging an external inverter in.
customer_reviews.author: SoundMan

customer_reviews.title: I bought this and had great success charging my phone and other electronic devices and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and had great success charging my phone and other electronic devices and jump starting my motorcycle. In an effort to hook up the power cable and recharge the charger from a house outlet the prongs broke off inside the device. They snapped right off. Yes, they are broken off inside the unit. I'm sure. I now have an expensive boat anchor which I purchased less than six months ago and it's now a boat anchor. A horrible disapointment.
customer_reviews.author: mtd076

customer_reviews.title: Never worked properly
customer_reviews.text: It appeared to be a good price especially due to all of the functions it has... only used the air compressor once, the first time I tried to jump start a vehicle with it, it didn't work, even though it was fully charged. Now every time I turn on the jump start feature I get a loud tone that doesn't stop until I turn it off...Of course I've thrown away the box and can't seem to find the operation manual... so I don't know if there is any kind of warranty or not...maybe I just received a bad one...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Beckner

customer_reviews.title: I am quite pleased
customer_reviews.text: Powered up my Cpac and tested it for 6 hours. 25% left on charge so I expect it to work all night. This is why I bought this tool so I am quite pleased. Re-charging takes a long time so I marked it at a 4
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent while it works
customer_reviews.text: Worked excellent for about a year then wires started to short out then the on / off switch went bad Notified company and wouldn't sell part (switch) Would have to send unit in for repair an it would cost more then l paid for
customer_reviews.author: John Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and the the 12volt outlets don't work. And Schumacher wants me to send it back on my dime for almost $50.00. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Mikka

customer_reviews.title: Car jump - Good Cold weather to run a small CPAP - eh
customer_reviews.text: Car jump - Good Cold weather to run a small CPAP - eh.... only lasted 3 hours Warm weather to run small CPAP - better... lasted the night (5-6 hours) Recharge rate seemed slow however, it may be due to the seemingly inconsistent readout when checking the charge level.
customer_reviews.author: The War Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Lives in my car
customer_reviews.text: You need this. I have one in my car. It has jump started cars, inflated car and bike tires, recharged camera, phone, iPad batteries, and served as a flashlight. I bought it after we lost power for a day and it was incredibly useful. It is much cheaper and easier to use than a generator for most things. I have one in my house and one in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: Battery terminal clamp cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my RV in case we lost battery power. I had it for about two weeks and took one trip with it in the RV. When I went to use it, miraculously the battery clamp had broken. And I have no idea how that happened. But the plastic is so cheap I can't imagine it lasting very long for anybody. I couldn't return it but Amazon gave me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: S. Nelles

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product! Must buy if you want piece of mind in your vehicle. We purchased this to provide back up power for our tablets during a restaurant street event. This gave us enough power to keep the phones charged, Square tablet registers runnning and a portable set of flood lights. ALL ON ONE CHARGE. This lasted for the entire event of 5 hours! If it has that much power, it will jump your car without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: verbilkent

customer_reviews.title: it was nice that I could keep my phone and laptop going ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this product for a year and it has saved me more than a few times. Also is much easier to pull this out of my trunk to jump someone else's vehicle. Holds its charge for a very, very long time. When power was out in my home for over 2 days, it was nice that I could keep my phone and laptop going throughout. Aces!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel James

customer_reviews.title: Pictures and Directions do not match product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for emergencies, this is not the first power station I have owned. Needed to pump a tire on Thanksgiving morning and found no piece on the then of the air hose to attach to tire. Tried to screw onto tire and lost more air. Directions indicate that there is a piece on the air hose. Called customer service at a later date and was told the pictures and directions do not match the item, just screw it on the tire. I reported that it did not work and was told that it was too late to return the item.
customer_reviews.author: unsat

customer_reviews.title: Great Product & Well Worth The Extra Money Compared To Cheaper Brands
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I originally bought a similar one from Harbor Freight and it would not hold a charge. We have used this during power outages and to charge the battery on the riding lawn mower. Well worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Lanette

customer_reviews.title: Awesome deal and though it is a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome deal and though it is a bit heavy, worked like a charm and I used it for 3 weeks on a Rte 66 trip in my trailer- plugged in cell, and small (travel 12V) hair dryer and more. Plugged into auto while on the road but it stayed well charged and as it was described.
customer_reviews.author: JANA

customer_reviews.title: Will never live without one!!!
customer_reviews.text: My old unit finally quit after 20+ years. I've already used the new unit 3x's over this past winter including the air compressor for a very low tire. It works great and is much more heavy duty than my old unit. I like the push button digital readout on the front for the charge status.
customer_reviews.author: Calmundo

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I've jumped off a truck and a lawn mower, with no issues. Also used the AC outlets to power some lasers and strobe lights for trunk-r-treat back at Halloween! Of course, the AC inverter does have limits. It will NOT power the heating unit on a 400 watt fog machine, but other than that, it's all good!
customer_reviews.author: Puresound1

customer_reviews.title: Works well until it dies.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 6 years ago. Worked well. Finally died last month. (Just shy of 6 yrs.) Used primarily as a cpap backup battery for camping once a year.It was good for 6 hrs a night. Also used to jumpstart cars occasionally. Bummer, I have to get a new one for $50 more.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne L.

customer_reviews.title: This product is complete garbage. Will hardly jump start my lawn mower when ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is complete garbage. Will hardly jump start my lawn mower when the battery is just a little drained. Have tried using it on a few cars when they do not have quite enough battery in the cold weather. Does not work I have tried to send it back but for some reason amazon does not accept returns for this item.
customer_reviews.author: joe m.

customer_reviews.title: good unit
customer_reviews.text: Not used much at this point. Does have new charging method, just plug an extension cord into the unit to charge. Has good features and seems well built, would recommend. Update 5/2015. Unit will allow you to revive a battery that is too low to start a vehicle. However, a completely dead battery may be beyond this units capacity. I use the air inflation capacity to inflate my queen size air mattress all the time. Works great for that.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for sleep apnea machine :(
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this did not work for me. I read the reviews before purchasing because I needed something to use while camping without electricity to run my sleep apnea machine. This would only last 4-5 hours and be dead. I would charge it using a generator during the day for 5-7 hours and it just wouldn't fully charge and then would start losing charge immediately after unplugging without anything being plugged into it. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin V

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but good feature bundle
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described, the included instrcutions are a little basic but it's not that hard to figure out. Uses older, heavier batteries than more modern Litium Ion car starter sets now on the marker but with the onboard 120 Volt option can function as a home/camping back up power supply. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: tek-nique

customer_reviews.title: Love It - Awesome Gift
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life saver since we live in a very cold winter region. Car battery doesn't die often, but I've used it twice on my cars and a few times on motorcycle before replacing old battery. Very nice not having to trickle charge a battery back to life - especially when you are in a hurry to go somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cox

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a short period of time
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a short period of time, then battery start dying so fast and needs to be recharged very often. No reliable product, even so I have bought several units during the last couple of years just because the price!
customer_reviews.author: alberto noguez

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and has a nice design
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and has a nice design. All of the cables and hoses stay put when you're not using it so they're not tangling up in your trunk. Easy to maintain, it just needs charged once a month and it holds a charge just fine. Also, it works great for a portable power source!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Performed perfectly the first time
customer_reviews.text: By no small miracle this product arrived unscathed after being packaged and shipped in possibly one of the worst packing jobs that I have had the misfortune to be a customer to. The product arrived opened and then resealed with a sticker over the opening tab located on the product box. After reading the manual, I proceeded to charge the product as specified only to find that it was already charged. Being skeptical, I promptly took the product to my poor vehicle (which had an undercharged battery and would not start my vehicle) and promptly connected the product and now I have a very happy vehicle and family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Comes in very handy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for Christmas. It brought a huge smile to my hubby face. He had been wanting one of these. Very pleased and it arrived on time. I do wish it would have come with the 2 attachment cords that I had to buy separately. Otherwise, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joswen E.

customer_reviews.title: its the BEST THING I'VE EVER OWNED
customer_reviews.text: I left my blinker lights on for over 6 hours, which ran down my battery! used my Schmacher for the first time and it was RIGHT ON TIME! Mostly, I've been using it to inflate my car tires, and that has worked very well. I have NO COMPLAINTS about my Schumacher XP2260 Portable Battery Charger, its the BEST THING I'VE EVER OWNED, after purchasing two other Portable Battery Charger's!
customer_reviews.author: Earthie Earth

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to jump multiple cars and trucks without issue. Used it to power a house lamp with a florescent 60 watt equivalent bulb for about an hour just because. Just make sure you check and charge it regularly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MDS

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for astronomers
customer_reviews.text: No complaints here. Bought for making astrophotography rig mobile and it was perfect. Use deep cycle battery setup now because of too many cameras and gear going at once but still take this for a backup. This would keep a camera/guide camera/dew heaters/mount/computer going all night
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: excellent used it for cpap powered cpap
customer_reviews.text: excellent used it for cpap powered cpap, resumed S9 iPhones, for 2 nights. Takes up to 6 hours to charge from car battery though and have to leave car on. Quicker to charge it from a mains outright if you can use a socket in a restaurant or hotel .
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: This power station is awesome! I got one for my sister to use ...
customer_reviews.text: This power station is awesome! I got one for my sister to use and liked it so much I had to buy one for myself so I did not have to keep borrowing hers. I love how versatile it is! It is great for leaving in the car and breaking it out whenever you need it. It has come in really handy while camping too! Between the air compressor and the outlets it gets a lot of use camping and at the lake.
customer_reviews.author: WagsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Alligator clip broke after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for 2.5 years and the red alligator clip just broke at the hinge because the hinge is made of under-built plastic. So now to attach the clip to a battery post, I'd have to hold the clip on by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I liked that this could be used to charge my phone ...
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after a couple years of light use. If you have a truck look to something stronger - couldn't jump my F150 truck. I liked that this could be used to charge my phone during power outages. When the power went out it took a couple tries to get it to actually charge and then failed altogether a month later so this didn't pan out as well as I had hoped. Good concept, questionable quality.
customer_reviews.author: David Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: Cranks my old truck, pumps my old tires, ...
customer_reviews.text: Cranks my old truck, pumps my old tires, flattens air beds. Runs lights off 110v, when the powers out. Solid, just solid.
customer_reviews.author: Richard N.

customer_reviews.title: Great overall automobile device when you need help.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful battery to recharge drained battery, easy to use air pump for low pressure tires, convenient and quiet USB chargers for portable devices, must have!
customer_reviews.author: Wafer S.

customer_reviews.title: Power
customer_reviews.text: Worked great during hurricane Irma and the week of no power afterwards. Plugged a 13" LED TV into it and it played for 3 days along with charging everyone's cell phones. Then charged up in the car inverter while driving. Haven't tried the jump start yet. Keeps a 100% charge in storage for months.
customer_reviews.author: David Kandel

customer_reviews.title: I'll use this every time I go camping!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a camping 4 nights. Kept quite a few phones charged up as well as other portable chargers and speakers. Died on the 3rd day. It did its job and more so I couldn't complain. Got home and charged it up, took about 20 hours.
customer_reviews.author: B Dope

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2010 Tahoe and it has that HUSH, HUSH little issue with the battery discharging for no reason that the dealer says doesn't exist. Anyhow my wife is using this and loving the fact that it works better than we could have expected. While I figure this mess with the Chevy I feel safe that my wife has a back up. It works better than the garage charger on my 1978 toy that keeps dying from not being played with. Bottom line........works as advertised!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: I have two of these
customer_reviews.text: These units work well. I use them while camping. One unit typically lasts me 3 days. I typically use them to recharge cell phones and power speakers. For those tasks, the external devices can be plugged in via the USB ports or via the standard outlet ports. I've also used the air inflation hose to pump up a football. By contrast, I haven't yet tried to pump up a vehicle tire or jump start a car. The units recharge in just a few hours when plugged in to a standard outlet at home.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Case

customer_reviews.title: Backup power source
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a back up power source in our rv. It's the perfect solution. Charge it up when the generator is on. We can turn the generator off when the weather is nice and still have a digital clock, charge our phones, etc. I haven't used the air compressor or jumper cables yet but those were just a bonus for my needs anyway. This purchase was well worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: JenLivingLife

customer_reviews.title: The best model
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I always have one of these in the car, especially in the winter. All the pictures look the same for each unit in the series, there are three. This particular model is the only one that has what you see in the picture, 2ac, 2dc, USB port etc..... plus much more. +++++
customer_reviews.author: LilBit

customer_reviews.title: seems like the maker had 1 too many as all the ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased these power station because of the many accessories. however, seems like the maker had 1 too many as all the accessories work "okay". i was excited to use the blow hose on the back to blow up inflatable and air mattress but this hose has no power and wont fill a balloon. also the tire pressure is very weak. i also tried to use this to charge my dewalt radio which has an 18v battery and this machine shut down. its for cell phones and small items but just does not meet my expectations for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: frank montana

customer_reviews.title: Just remember to take it with you!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best portable power source I have ever used. As an auto dealer, we go through these quite often so I decided there had to be a better one out there. With the help of Amazon and Google review, I narrowed the choice down to a couple and I have had previous experience with Schumacher I went with this one. Man am I a happy camper.....no really, I am a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: DavidMassillonOh

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Compressor stops after 5 minutes of continued use. Power percentage gauge is near useless...will display 100% charged right after charging, and right after running the compressor for 20ish minutes (after 4 stops for "overheating" or something"...which is impossible. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M

customer_reviews.title: This power came in handy this weekend when car battery ...
customer_reviews.text: This power came in handy this weekend when car battery died. I don't drive my car too often which caused the battery to lose it's charge. I wasn't able to use jumper cables due to the way it was positioned in the garage. My husband used this and it started instantly.
customer_reviews.author: LauraLee

customer_reviews.title: nice. We took it camping for seven days and ...
customer_reviews.text: When we received the product it was fully charged, nice. We took it camping for seven days and had no problems. We used it to blow up mattrice and charger many cell phones and electronic devices. The pack worked perficly. Got home and machine still showed 22. I am so glad that I get this machine. Now it has been recharge and is waiting for the next power outage. Thank Schumacher for making a great product. Tina in CT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont expect a good compressor (or maybe even a working one)
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is my second one now as the last ones compressor blew up after 5 minutes of use topping up my tires. Everything else seems good but the compressor is definitely lacking. I saw a review saying that and figured eh what if it's a little slow as long as it works, seems it might not work for long though. It does fine jump starting my car though (had to do it several times since buying) and that is my main use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a worthwhile unit
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before deciding to buy this unit. I needed something to power my CPAP machine during power outages. When a lamp using a CFL bulb was plugged into this unit, the bulb flickered on and off very rapidly. I charged the battery up when it arrived in late December 2013, and it still shows a 97% charge during the second week of March 2014.
customer_reviews.author: Hob Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this box!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out of the box.. I plugged it in to charge and the unit will not charge seems to be a loose connection on the unit I tried a couple different extension cords. When holding a cord just right on the built in plug I can get the green led to stay on. Bottom line it’s junk!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy T.

customer_reviews.title: Great features if they last
customer_reviews.text: First 3 months awesome for only using 6 or 7 times to charge phone tab etc. Jump started a few vehicles no issue. Less than a year later and not good. Follow all charging and use by the manual. The pump for both auto and inflatables is a joke. Makes weird noises when charging. Would pay a fair price for one with 2000 peak amps and same features that function longer than a year. Make the pump stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Smith (BABABOOEY)

customer_reviews.title: Bought two and one didn't work right out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two and one didn't work right out of the box. Because you can't return a battery, they refunded the money and sent a third. Also doesn't work well. Just doesn't charge right.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it on a regular basis yet, but so far does everything it is supposed to. More importantly, I am a lot more relaxed about being without power in emergency situations. My family can have some comfort. The only reason why I didn't rate it with five stars is because it took forever to get it (a whole week between purchase and shipping and then not delivered when it was supposed to AND I had to pick it up myself). Still, a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: SciFireader

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This one holds a charge much better than previous models I have had. Sturdier as well. Easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: robert c jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for only 2 years...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it back in 2015. It's been great until a few months ago (less than 2 years), battery doesn't hold the charge as much anymore, and pump stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Mazza

product_meta.title: Schumacher XP2260 1200 Peak Amp Instant Portable Power Source and Jump Starter
product_meta.description: This Schumacher Instant Portable Power Source has an on/off switch that activates the jump start mode. A built-in charger for automatic charging of the internal battery; just connect an extension cord to the plug to recharge (cord not included). The battery status LEDs tell when a battery is charged or needs to be charged. The Sure-Grip Clamps fit both top and side-mount batteries. The cable will stay flexible in the coldest weather. A maintenance-free, sealed lead acid battery allow for storage in any position. The unit must be charged for 72 hours before use for the first time.
feature_bullets: On/Off switch activates the jump starting mode. Cold Crank Amps- 185. Crank Amps 30 Sec- 255. Crank Amps 5 Sec- 300. Air Compressor- 150 PSI
Built-in charger for automatic charging of internal battery; Battery status LEDs indicate when battery is charged or needs to be charged
Built-in 400 Watt power inverter for 120V AC household power ; 12 Volt accessory outlet
Sure-Grip clamps fit both top and side-mount batteries,The unit must be charged for 72 hours before use for the first time.
A maintenance-free, sealed lead acid battery allow for storage in any position
Special Shipping Information: This item cannot be returned and has additional shipping restrictions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars1,058 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars

categories: Jump Starters, Battery Chargers & Portable Power
